ResourceHeader.ResourceName: STEREO-A Ephemeris in the HCI Coordinate System
ResourceHeader.Description: STEREO atttitude and orbit data are distributed as SPICE kernels. Since most SEP investigators would rather not deal with SPICE kernels, Caltech provides text files containing position data for the two STEREO spacecraft, in the following coordinate systems: GEI, GSE, GSM, HCI, HEE, HEEQ.

InformationURL.Name: Pointing and Orbit Data for the SEP Instruments on the STEREO Spacecraft
InformationURL.Description: This document provides information about orientation of the LET instrument on the STEREO Ahead and Behind spacecraft, and instructions for calculating pointing (attitude) and position vectors for any SEP instrument from the spacecraft ancillary data.

AccessURL.Name: STEREO Attitude and Orbit Data
AccessURL.Description: Predicted or definitive STEREO attitude and orbit data are generated from SPICE kernels and offered in various coordinate system.

NumericalData.Caveats: These data are produced at Caltech for the benefit of SEP instrument suite investigators. The data are not currently officially "blessed" by the larger STEREO team. The time cadence of records within data files is variable. A new record is appended only at the beginning of each day, or if the position of the S/C changes by more than TOL kilometers from the previous position. TOL is currently set to 5000 km. However, the position is only sampled every 5 minutes, so for some coordinate systems the position resolution is less than 5000 km. The daily updating of these data goes 61 days into the future, and 20 days into the past. This is usually sufficient to ensure that all the data in the files eventually get promoted form "predicted" to "definitive". Occasionally, the data are manually checked to make sure that this is all working as expected.

Parameter.Name: Year
Parameter.Description: The year of the data point

Parameter.Name: DOY
Parameter.Description: The day of year of the data point

Parameter.Name: Second
Parameter.Description: The second of the day of the data point

Parameter.Name: Flag
Parameter.Description: 0 if the data are predictive and 1 if the data are definitive

Parameter.Name: X
Parameter.Description: The X component of the spacecraft position vector

Parameter.Name: Y
Parameter.Description: The Y component of the spacecraft position vector

Parameter.Name: Z
Parameter.Description: The Z component of the spacecraft position vector
